intro: Afropectinariella gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in a fine, silky pubescence. Afropectinariella gabonensis is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist environments with well-drained soil.
